WorkItem.Description:
Probably related to #1347, the answer there was to save the file in UTF-8 encoding rather than ANSI.

So when I have a character like __Ã __ in my file, you expect me to go to _File -> Save As... -> Save with Encoding..._ to satisfy the compiler?
Visual Studio should be saving files as UTF-8 regardless, but it doesn't, and since Visual Studio is the most common environment for TypeScript, the compiler should be able to handle this.

__Update__
The source of the problem is the default encoding of a TS file.
For example, the default encoding of a C# class is UTF-8 because ```C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 11.0\Common7\IDE\NewFileItems\csharpclass.cs``` is encoded in UTF-8.
The default encoding of a TS file is ANSI, because ```C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 11.0\Common7\IDE\NewScriptItems\file.ts``` is encoded in ANSI.

Similarly, the default encoding of app.ts in the TS project template should be fixed.
